summary: July 9 is the 190th day of the year  in the Gregorian calendar.
full_text: Ian David Russell Bradshaw  is a Barbadian cricketer who played for West Indies as a left-arm medium-fast bowler and a left-handed batsman. He captained the West Indies U-19 team, but his senior debut came two months before his 30th birthday, when he was selected to play in the last three One Day Internationals of the seven-match series against England. After taking five wickets in the three matches, he became a permanent fixture. In September 2004, Bradshaw won the 2004 Champions Trophy with West Indies, his only one-day title to date, and Bradshaw was named Man of the Match in the final. He made his Test debut in March 2006, taking three wickets in each innings against New Zealand, and played five matches before being dropped in June.
title: Ian Bradshaw
